item.title: GPT-4.5 for enterprise: Do its accuracy and knowledge justify the cost?
item.description: The price of GPT-4.5 is very steep. But it doesn't mean that it's a failure (or that it will always be so expensive).

item.title: Semantic understanding, not just vectors: How Intuit’s data architecture powers agentic AI with measurable ROI
item.description: From automation to autonomy: How Intuit's 'done for you' agentic AI architecture drives concrete business outcomes.

item.title: Industry observers say GPT-4.5 is an “odd” model, question its price
item.description: Industry leaders find GPT 4.5 an interesting mix of capable model without pushing the boundaries of LLMs too much.

item.title: OpenAI releases ‘largest, most knowledgable’ model GPT-4.5 with reduced hallucinations and high API price
item.description: GPT-4.5 API pricing appears shockingly high, costing developers $75 and $180 for 1 million tokens in and out, respectively.

item.title: PlayerUnknown Productions reveals trailer for emergent open-world survival game
item.description: PUBG creator Brendan Greene is back with a trailer for Prologue: Go Wayback, which will hit Steam early access this summer.
